snippet: Former President Jimmy Carter cited a 15-percent drop in cases last year as he helped open an exhibition on diseases at the American Museum of Natural History.
abstract: Former Pres Jimmy Carter, during opening of exhibit at American Museum of Natural History, reports that there were 126 cases of Guinea worm disease around world in 2014, 15 percent drop from 2013; says last outbreaks are in South Sudan, Mali, Chad and Ethiopia, complicating final push for eradication.
lead_paragraph: Former President Jimmy Carter cited a 15-percent drop in cases last year as he helped open an exhibition on diseases at the American Museum of Natural History.

headline.print_headline: At Museum, New Front in Guinea Worm Fight
headline.main: At Museum, New Front in Guinea Worm Fight
